repastcity3.agent
Interface IAgent

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultAgent
public interface IAgent

All agents must implement this interface so that it the simulation knows how to step them.

Author:
Nick Malleson

Method Detail

step

void step()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Controls the agent. This method will be called by the scheduler once per iteration.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isThreadable

boolean isThreadable()
Used by Agents as a means of stating whether or not they can be run in parallel (i.e. there is no inter-agent communication which will make parallelisation non-trivial). If all the agents in a simulation return true, and the computer running the simulation has more than one core, it is possible to step agents simultaneously.

setHome

void setHome(Building home)
Set where the agent lives.

getHome

Building getHome()
Get the agent's home.

addToMemory

<T> void addToMemory(java.util.List<T> objects,
                     java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
(Optional). Add objects to the agents memory. Used to keep a record of all the buildings that they have passed.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
objects - The objects to add to the memory.
clazz - The type of object.

getTransportAvailable

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTransportAvailable()
(Optional). Get the transport options available to this agent. E.g. an agent with a car who also could use public transport would return {"bus", "car"}. If null then it is assumed that the agent walks (the slowest of all transport methods).
